com.MASTAdView
Interface MASTAdDelegate.AdActivityEventHandler

Enclosing class:
MASTAdDelegate
public static interface MASTAdDelegate.AdActivityEventHandler

Interface which supports custom callback to be invoked when ad view is attached to or detached from an activity (window), and when a banner ad view "expands" in any way (MRAID expand, resize, or interstitial display), and closes back again.

Method Summary
 void onAdAttachedToActivity(MASTAdView sender)
          This is called when the view is attached to a window.
 boolean onAdClicked(MASTAdView sender, java.lang.String url)
          Invoked when a URL is being loaded in the ad view.
 void onAdCollapsed(MASTAdView sender)
          This is called when an expanded view is closed, returning to banner state, or "gone" for interstitial ads, after the close button is pressed.
 void onAdDetachedFromActivity(MASTAdView sender)
          This is called when the view is detached to a window.
 void onAdExpanded(MASTAdView sender, int height, int width)
          This is called when a banner ad expands to larger size using the MRAID expand method.
 void onAdResized(MASTAdView sender, int height, int width)
          This is called when a banner ad resizes to a larger size using the MRAID resize method.
 

Method Detail

onAdAttachedToActivity

void onAdAttachedToActivity(MASTAdView sender)
This is called when the view is attached to a window. See the underlying web view onAttachedToWindow documentation for more information.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originated is passed as a parameter.

onAdDetachedFromActivity

void onAdDetachedFromActivity(MASTAdView sender)
This is called when the view is detached to a window. See the underlying web view onDetachedToWindow documentation for more information.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originated is passed as a parameter.

onAdClicked

boolean onAdClicked(MASTAdView sender,
                    java.lang.String url)
Invoked when a URL is being loaded in the ad view. See the documentation for the underlying web view shouldOverrideUrlLoading () method for more information.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originates.
url - URL to be loaded in ad view.
Returns:
Boolean true if caller has completely handled the click event and wants to skip the default SDK click processing; return false if the caller has only implemented a "side-effect" such as logging, and wants the default SDK logic to continue.

Sample code which shows a custom click listener is as follows: 

 class UserAdActivityEventHandler implements AdActivityEventHandler {
     ... other required methods ...
     public boolean onAdClicked(MASTAdView arg0, String arg1) {
         // This class method is responsible for invoking a handler to run
         // code on the UI thread that displays information about the event.
         updateUi("Click url = "+ arg1);
         return false; // SDK should continue processing click
     }
 }
 
 adView.getAdDelegate().setAdActivityHandler(new UserAdActivityEventHandler());

See the sample application source code for complete source for this use case.

onAdExpanded

void onAdExpanded(MASTAdView sender,
                  int height,
                  int width)
This is called when a banner ad expands to larger size using the MRAID expand method.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originated is passed as a parameter.
height - Height of "expanded" view.
width - Width of "expanded" view.

onAdResized

void onAdResized(MASTAdView sender,
                 int height,
                 int width)
This is called when a banner ad resizes to a larger size using the MRAID resize method.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originated is passed as a parameter.
height - Height of "expanded" view.
width - Width of "expanded" view.

onAdCollapsed

void onAdCollapsed(MASTAdView sender)
This is called when an expanded view is closed, returning to banner state, or "gone" for interstitial ads, after the close button is pressed.

Parameters:
sender - The ad view from which the event originated is passed as a parameter.
